newsitem.title: USA: Nev. Mohave unit 1 holding at 614 MW after outage.
newsitem.headline: Nev. Mohave unit 1 holding at 614 MW after outage.

text.p: The 790 megawatt (MW) unit 1 at the Mohave coal-fired power plant near Laughlin, Nev., was operating at 614 MW after restarting on Wednesday, a spokesman for the plant said Thursday.
"I don't think it will be going up much from here because there is no need for more power," he said.
The unit had been down since Friday due to a tube leak.
Mohave's 790 MW unit 2 was said to be running at 710 MW.
Southern California Edison Co is the majority owner and operator of the Mohave units.
